subject: Re: [junit] Testing Frameworks Configuration (Hibernate)
msgSnippet: Thanks David!!!! I discovered after my post that hibernate does much of the validation i was needing, so for the moment I´m ok. I got messed up with tools
messageBody:
Thanks David!!!!

I discovered after my post that hibernate does much of the validation
i was needing, so for the moment I´m ok. I got messed up with tools
(spring+hibernate) :-S

But I like the concept of separating configuration tests of
integration test. Most of my bugs come of configuration files, so it´s
nice to have them tested. The problem always is the cost of making
such tests, that´s why i like second approach.

Mariano

PS: Sorry for the answer delay!
